doc.content: If all the cats and dogs in Jefferson County only knew what kind of party is about to be thrown for them. This coming Sunday, more than 400 items ranging from Tiffany glass to a dinner for four with television political commentator Jack Germond will be auctioned Sunday at the Clarion Hotel and Conference Center in Shepherdstown. The auction, which organizers hope will raise more than $30,000, will be used to help pay for operating the Jefferson County Animal Welfare Society and Spay Today, an organization that helps people spay and neuter pets at a reduced cost, organizers said. The Jefferson County Animal Welfare Society, an animal shelter along Leetown Road, has been struggling with finances and accommodating large numbers of unwanted pets.
